message: The xml:id of the TEI element should be equal to the name of the file, without the file extension. Currently the value of xml:id is "SSK_sc_scholarsStandardsV2" whilst the file name is "SSK_sc_scholarsStandardsV2.xml"
TEI/@type should be either "researchScenario" or "researchStep". The current value of TEI/@type is "researchScenario"

test: tei:date and tei:persName and tei:affiliation and tei:desc
message: When recording a revision, some precise metadata must be given : the date of the revision, the name of the responsibe and his/her affiliation and a description.

nodeText:
In medieval studies, it is often needed to define in an
     unambiguous way information like person names (i.e.: authors), titles of works and documents
     identifiers (i.e.: shelfmarks). In fact, information can frequently be ambiguous: there are
     several cases of homonimy; an author can have more than one appellation known; the title of a
     work can have different forms, and also shelfmarks may have different structures. The quantity
     of material involved in the research and the time employed to perform it may vary depending on
     the subject of the research itself.
message: In the <desc type="definition>, there should be nothing more than text, <list> and <ref>.
sourceDesc in mandatory in TEI, so if you want to give details on the way the scenario was conceived, it is the appropriate location.

nodeText:
Representing information about authors, works,
     documents
message: The title of a scenario should describe the main goal of the scenario.
A scenario could have several keywords related to standards. Check the documentation for more details
A scenario could have several keywords related to research techniques. Check the Tadirah taxonomy for more details.
A scenario could have several keywords related to research objects. Check the Tadirah taxonomy for more details.
